titleStmt.title: Dǝrsāna sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” / Malkǝʾa sanbata krǝstiyān “Image of the Sabbath of Christians”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: I) Dәrsanä sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug) (fols. 1r-33v, 38r-40v), incomplete and misplaced II) Malkǝʾa sanbata krǝstiyān “Image of the Sabbath of Christians”: 25 strophes (fols. 33v-37v, 41r-41v, 43r-44r).

msItem.title: I. Dǝrsāna sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jaqob of Serug)
msItem.incipit: 1r: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘሥሩግ፡ በእንተ፤ ሰንበተ፤ ክርስቲያን፤ ጸሎታ፡ ወበረከታ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ገብራ፡ [vac.] ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፨ ስምዑ፡ ፍቁራንየ፡ ውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፤… 1r: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. (This is) the homily which ʾabbā Jaqob of Serug composed on the Sabbath of Christians. May her prayer and her blessing be with her servant… Forever and ever. Listen, my beloved ones, sons of the church…
msItem.explicit: 33r, l.13: …ኦወልደ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፡ ዕቀቦ፡ ለገብርከ፡ [vac.] ወ[33v]ተሣሃሎ፡ በብርሃነ፡ ጸጋከ፡ ከልሎ፡ ወበምግባረ፤ ጽድቅ፤ አብዕሎ፡ ወበዘይመጽእ፡ ዓለም፡ በክብረ፡ ነፍስ፡ አልዕሎ፡ ምስለ፡ ኅሩያኒከ፡ መክፈልተ፡ ክፍሎ፡ ለገብርከ፡ [vac.] 33r, l.13: …O Son of the living God, protect your servant ... and have mercy upon him, with the light of your grace encircle him, and with the deeds of the righteousness enrich him. And in the world which will come, elevate him with the glory of the spirit, grant him a portion with your elects, to your servant ...

listBibl.bibl: - d´Abbadie 247 (19th cent.),80r-92v: “Sermon de Jacques de Saroug sur le dimanche” (ChAbb 139).

- EMML n400 (late 19th cent.), 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 116; Bookseller, Wälga Mǝḥratu, quarter of Takla Hāymānot, Addis Abäba).
- EMML n624 (1908), 3r-36v: “Homily on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML II, 372; Bookseller, Wälga Mǝḥratu, quarter of Takla Hāymānot, Addis Abäba).
- EMML n885 (1916/30), 3r-19r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML III, 210; Church of Qwǝsqwam, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba).

- EMML n1672 (20th cent.), 1r-66r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML V, 148; Private library of Mämhǝr Gabra Masqal Tasfāye, quarter of ʾƎnṭoṭṭo, Addis Abäba).
122r-147v: “Homily by James of Sarug on the Christian Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML X, 9; Church of Mäsḉa Māryām, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa).
- EMML n4362 (19th cent.), 1r-15r: “Homily on the (Christian) Sabbath [Dersāna Sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 125; Church of ʾƎllägänd Mikāʾel, ʾAnkobärr, Shoa).
The Mss. containing only “Dǝrsāna sanbata krǝstiyān” without “Malkǝʾa sanbata krǝstiyān”:

124r-137v: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 302; Church of Miṭaq ʾAmanuʾel, Ankobärr, Shoa).
3r-27r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 372; Church of ʾƎlqo Madḫāne ʿĀlam, Ankobärr, Shoa).
222r-228r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday” (EMML VI, 463; Church of Miṭaq Takla Hāymānot, Ankobärr, Shoa).
4r-5r: “Homily of James of Sarug on the observance of Sunday [Dersāna sanbat]” (EMML VII, 117; Church of Ḥarr ʾAmba Yoḥannǝs, Ankobärr, Shoa).
2r-4v, 5r-6v, 15rv, 17rv, 18rv, 20r-21r, 22r-23v: “Homily on the Sabbath [Dersāna sanbat] ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML VIII, 150; Church of Sarya Mikāʾel, Zanǧira, Wärana Basso, Shoa).
48v-63v: “Homily of James of Sarug about Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 215; Church of Gädam Māryām, ʾAsagǝrt, Shoa).
146rv, 135r-145v, 147r-149v: “Homily of James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML VIII, 286; Church of Gubbalafto Takla Hāymānot, Yäǧǧu, Wällo).
2r-3v: “Homily by James of Sarug on Christian Sabbath” (EMML IX, 256; Church of Laǧǧa Gǝnd Giyorgis, Wärana Baso, Shoa).
182r-186r: “Homily on Sunday [Dersāna sanbat], ascribed to James of Sarug” (EMML X, 152; Church of Sälla Dǝnqay Marqos, Moǧa and Wädärra, Shoa).
fols. 1-28 (cp. M. WURMBRAND, “Le ´Dersana Sanbat`. Une homélie éthiopienne attribuée a Jacques de Saroug”, L´Orient syrien 8, 1963, 344).

note.p: The text is incomplete: some leaves are missing after 29v. 38r-40v have been misplaced: they should be before 30r.

msItem.title: II. Malkǝʾa sanbata krǝstiyān “Image of the Sabbath of Christians”
msItem.incipit: 33v, l.6: ሰላም፡ [ለ]አዝከረ፡ ስምኪ፡ ስመ፡ ነከራ፡ ወተዓፅቦ፨ ወለርእስኪ፡ ሰላም፡ ብርሃነ፡ መለኮት፡ ዘይገለብቦ። ሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ቅድስት፡ ዕረፍተ፡ ኀጥአን፡ እምተመንድቦ፨ ዕቀበኒ፡ ለመልአከ፡ ኀጕል፡ ከመ፡ ኢይኩን፡ መርከቦ፨ 33v, l.6: Salutation to the reminding of your name, the name of wonder and astonishment. And salutation to your head, which the light of the divinity covers. St Sabbath of Christians, repose of the sinners from the torments. Protect me so that I would not become a ship of the angel of perdition!
msItem.explicit: 44r, l. 7: …ሰን፡ ክ፡ ቅ፡ ሀብኒ፡ ፍትሐ፡ ሣህልኪ፡ ለላዕለቴ[sic]: በከመ፡ <…> ይነሥእ፡ ዓሰ ባ[sic]፡ ፃማሁ፡ ዝ ንተ፡ <…> አሳባ፡ ድርሳንየ፡ ኢይጥፋዕ፡ በከንቱ። 44r, l. 7: … St Sabbath of Christians, give me the justice of your high compassion; as <…> he takes a reward of his toils, this <…& the reward of my writing may not perish in vain. (?)

note.p: The text, between 37v and 44r, is interrupted by Text II: 38r-40v (Text I) have been misplaced and rebound between them (quire VI).

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 44.0 folios, of which blank 42rv, 44v, in 6.0 quires .
145 110 30

list.item:
7
I(8/fols. 1r-8v) ― II(8/fols. 9r-16v) ― III(8/fols. 17r-24v) ― IV(5/fols. 25r-29v [fols. missing]) ― V(8/fols. 30r-37v) ― VI(7/fols. 38r-44v).
ff. 38r-40v (Text I) have been misplaced; according to the text, they should be before fol. 30r.

supportDesc.condition: The threads of the binding are broken. Some leaves are loose, some crudely attached to the binding by secondary, irregular stitches. Many leaves are damaged by rodents (esp. fols.: 1-8; 25-29; 38-44). Cut repaired on 33. Some leaves are missing after 29v; 38r-40v have been misplaced: they should be before 30r.

layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: colon with short lines above and below (e.g. fols.: 1r, ls. 4, 5, 9, 10, 13; 4r, l.3; 25v, ls. 3, 7, 11, 12).
II. Four dot asterisk (e.g. fols.: 35v, l.2; 41v, ls.3, 7; 43v, ls. 1, 5, 8, 10);
nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
ሰላ᎓ for ሰላም᎓ on 41r l.16, 41v l.14, 43r l.6.
ሰንበ᎓ ቅድ᎓ for ሰንበተ᎓ ክርስቲያን᎓ on 41v l.10.
ሰንበተ᎓ ክር᎓ ቅድ᎓ for ሰንበተ᎓ ክርስቲያን᎓ ቅድስት᎓ on 43r l.9.
ሰ᎓ ክ᎓ ቅድ᎓ for ሰንበተ᎓ ክርስቲያን᎓ ቅድስት᎓ on 43v l.16.
ሰን᎓ ክ᎓ ቅ᎓ for ሰንበተ᎓ ክርስቲያን᎓ ቅድስት᎓ on 44r l.7.

handDesc.handNote: The handwriting is characterized by right-sloping and thick letters.
The quality of the hand varies in Text II, where it appears less regular and uniform.
The words እግዚአብሔር፡ and እግዚእ፡ are usually written with ligature between ግ and ዚ (e.g., 4r, 23r l.10).

binding.decoNote: Reddish-brown leather boards (two pieces of leather roughly sewn to each on the spine). One pair of sewing station.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.
